meta.description: Cathay Pacific The Wing First Class Lounge at Hong Kong International Airport (HKG), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Cathay Pacific The Wing First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Level 7, turn left immediately after Immigration, near Gates 1-4

location.description: Chek Lap Kok, Hong Kong, China

lounge.description: The Wing is Cathay Pacificâ€™s flagship lounge at the Hong Kong International Airport. It set a new standard in airline ground service when it launched in 1998, offering passengers unparalleled levels of comfort and convenience. Inside this exclusive space, passengers have the freedom to recharge, relax, or catch up on some work.

reviews.content: Lounge open again to first and oneworld emerald. Sit down food good, service slow. Buffet typical continental. Champagne very good. Chairs juice but very worn. See pic.
Lots of space and different seating options. Ã€ la carte dining and champagne bar. The space is mostly open towards the gates and might be noisy. I prefer the Pier First as itâ€™s more peaceful.

I still prefer The Pier, but if youâ€™re looking for an extravagant bathing experience, this is the one to go to! Get a cabana and pamper yourself in the worldâ€™s most luxurious bathroom in an airport!
Close to the shopping, so stopping here before doing some of that. There is a sit down restaurant to order alacarte or a buffet. Very surprised buffet has a small selection. Expected more!
Great food, great service, very peaceful.
People are kind and friendly. Also food is very nice.
Average food, noisy. Convenient, but not relaxing. Nothing like The Pier.
What can I say that has not already been mentioned? The cabanas are great. The Haven awesome. Staff very helpful. Great place to unwind.
Oh my...obviously everyone raves about the cabanas, but it was better than I even expected/hoped it would be. Gonna have a hard time deciding between Cabana versus going to The Pier!
Amazing lounge, but the other Cathay First lounge is better. Only benefit here is to ask for a Bath suite (not shower suite), they are mind blowing - couch included!
Took a refreshing shower in the cabana, enjoyed the Moet rosÃ© and had a meal in the made to order restaurant. Could not have been better! Can get a bit crowded during peak hours.
Fabulous classy chic and first class.
Excellent lounge, one of the best I've been too. Great food, awesome shower areas, take me back now. Love the tea made on demand!

Amazing cabanas to take a shower and relax. This lounge is open air whereas The Pier is all enclosed. The Wing doesn't feel as private and exclusive. It is located near the gates of most US bound flts.
Nice lounge. Excellent service. And the cabanas are simply heaven
Sit down dinner service was nice, everything was taken care of! Best service ever! Never had to see any passengers.
It has not been here since they have newer Pier . I noticed they have different seating near the entrance and they offer antipasto and chinese tea corner. Good work with the East meet West.ðŸ˜ƒ
One of the best lounges ever. Cabana shower suites are amazing. Champagne bar and a la carte dining are other highlights. Busiest first class lounge I've ever been to though.
Crowded, just too crowded for a F lounge. Dining is a disgrace as compared to the Pier where there is a larger a la carte selection and no 'all you can eat' buffet style spread.
Didn't get to use the cabanas as they were full. The lounge itself also. During peak hours almost impossible to find a good place. A la carte menu in the restaurant OK, but the buffet looked better.
Walk to "The Pier" if you can. This place gets easily crowded, though it is admittedly the one choice if you're departing from gates 1 to 4.
Perfect lounge with gentlemen's tonic foot massage and peninsula catering.
A great first lounge at the 'check in' end of the airport very convenient for gates 1-4. A bit aged compared to the new Pier First but still a great lounge.
Perhaps for a first class lounge it is not the best compared to others of its ilk. However, as a lounge itself it is absolutely much better than average - all of HKG CX lounges are.
Ok ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ... The lounge in HK is better.
Amazing food, amazing cabanas, amazing booze selection. Probably the best lounge in the world.
Unfriendly, dirty, very disappointed.
Nice place and friendly staff, with fantastic food and beverages.
Love this lounge! Make sure to check out the champagne bar.
The First Class area is a little sparse so you may want to go next door for food from the Noodle Bar in the Business Class lounge.
This is the lounge by which all others are measured. Unfortunately for them, this standard is unattainable.
Probably the best lounge in the world.

This lounge is up there. Gorgeous design. The haven serves up great food. A Moet champagne bar. A coffee and noodle bar. Great views. Only negative is the wifi is iffy but HK airport wifi is a backup.
Excellent in every way and less crowded than some alternatives like the Qantas lounge.
Very crowded and difficult to get a seat at peak times. Cabanas are hidden away and are on a walk up basis, great for a shower before your next flight.
While a bit crowded for a first class lounge, the service in the dining area is excellent, the champagne bar is a nice touch, and the cabanas are a nice private place to relax.
The a la carte isn't as good as the QF First Lounge in SYD - but very good buffet. The dining room is a little dark for my taste.
While the Cabana rooms are great, the rest of the FC lounge is cramped, crowded and unspectacular.
Spent about four hours in this great lounge. Get the cabanas if you can. Service is quick and excellent. Ample spaces to work and relax. Located to your left just after you clear immigration.
Just the place for a nice meal with excellent wines also the service to match, will come earlier next time for sure!.
Excellent food and service. Cabana rooms, very relaxed atmosphere.
This lounge is better than any US Lounge, with private cabanas and amazing selection of international publications. The food is just okay, though.
This is a nice place to unwind and relax. In addition, utlize the great showers to wash away travel grime.
Comfortable, excellent food and quiet most of the time. Decent selection of drinks. Cabanas are a good getaway for a nap or freshening up.
This is a fantastic lounge, with the cabanas being a great escape!
This is the best First Class Lounge in HKG. The restaurant is good, and the showers are great. Alas, the lounge is not that big, and therefore, gets crowded.
